intro: Mniodes spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf mniodes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
